website_summaries.verdict: Built-in telescopic stabilizers that travel with the RV trailer on the road. Best to consider for convenient use.
pros: The telescopic jacks swivel with a single crank so you can quickly place the stabilizer down to secure a trailer
Total weight capacity of 2,000 pounds is enough for smaller RVs and general equipment trailers
cons: Jacking unit requires securing to the trailer frame itself before use

customer_reviews.title: Attached to frame without problems. Lowered themselves and broke off while driving.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace jacks I had on my trailer. They look stronger and sturdier than the previous BAL telescoping jacks that I had. They mounted easily and attached securely to the frame without any problems. While towing to the campsite however, the vibrations from the dirt road caused the jacks to lower themselves and sheer off the frame. Luckily the car behind us saw them fall off and flagged us down. I have never had a problem with BAL products, but these jacks should not lower themselves by themselves while driving!
customer_reviews.author: Zach W

customer_reviews.title: Greatly reduced vibration when using washing machine
customer_reviews.text: I added a Spledide 2100 washer/dryer to my rv and had some shaking during the various wash cycles. Not real bad but bad enough. I replaced my rear scissor jacks with the BAL 24830 and it is night & day difference. These jacks are so much more stable. Highly recommend. The install was very easy with the only real work being getting my scissor jacks off.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It is like night and day difference
customer_reviews.text: It is so strange why the RV Manufacturer don't include this type of stabilizer. It is like night and day difference! Buy it it is worth every penny! Installed them on our Redwood 38RL and they actually fit in the back, just drill four holes and done. So much options when we bought the RV and this should definitely have been one.
customer_reviews.author: BasilFawlty

customer_reviews.title: Strong, adjustable width, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: VERY strong jack. I used on a slightly narrower trailer than suggested so I cut the frame down, which was EASY to do and doesn't affect the strength of the design etc. Just chop-saw the outer rail in the middle and paint the cut part, then it slides together and DONE... took 5 minutes to modify the width. Strong enough to lift my trailer off the ground if needed.
customer_reviews.author: SummitTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I also like the telescoping feature
customer_reviews.text: Stabilizer jacks did the trick. Eliminated almost all of the shake in the rear of our 34' 11" Silverback 5th Wheel Camper. This cper has the Lippert 6 pt. Auto Leveling System, still has shake in the rear living area. After installing the stabilizer jacks almost all of the shake is gone. I only had to drill 2 holes for the new jacks. I was able to use 2 existing holes. I also like the telescoping feature. It makes it very easy to adjust the width without sacrificing strength. I also added the BAL 20031 Deluxe Base Pads. These provided additional footprint for spreading the weight load. These installed very easy, also.
customer_reviews.author: Hackman53

customer_reviews.title: Much better than scissor jacks and far more stable
customer_reviews.text: Much better than scissor jacks and far more stable. Ever scissor jacks still move side to side when moving around in RV, this eliminates movement entirely
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: Greatly cut down on side to side sway. Also limited front to back. Best bet for front to back is still the wheel x chocks
customer_reviews.author: B.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These stabilizing jacks replaced the original pair that I accidentally bent up. These jacks are much stiffer and the stabilizer arms are much thicker and beefier. Easy to install. Price was right too.
customer_reviews.author: lcwb

customer_reviews.title: Best improvement I've made on our 31 foot trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Great stabilizer jacks. Remove the scissor jacks in these installed back in this exact same place. Took all the wiggle out of the trailer absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: High Qaulity
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installed on my enclosed Cargo trailer and couldn't be happier. I don't have to mess around with a floor jack and wood blocks anymore. Made from heavy steel and comes with a wrench to raise and lower the jacks. Installed with 5 bolts and took about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Well built, heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Very well built one piece setup. Very heavy duty. Adjustable. Had to send back because it was too long for holes to match up to frame on Casita trailer, even adjusted all the way in. Could have had it welded on, or extensions welded to frame but then decided to go with 2 separate jacks. That way if one side gets damaged I don't have to replace whole thing. Still will have to have a support welded on trailer frame for singles though.
customer_reviews.author: MikefromMichigan

customer_reviews.title: Get this
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my trailer in the back. I got the longer ones for the front. Great purchase. Much better than scissor jacks.
customer_reviews.author: c gliso

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made it better than the siccor style stabilizers but still not solid
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Clark

customer_reviews.title: By design these jacks are much more stable.
customer_reviews.text: I installed these jacks on my 35 foot Jayco Eagle. Easy to install and more stable than sissor jacks. Separate sissor jacks cost as much to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We will know soon as there are being welded onto the trailer, I have high expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: Good product, simple instructions and easy install. Welded to crossmember just past rear axle. Stabilized my class c very well.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Paulk

product_meta.title: BAL 24830 Telescopic Stabilizing Jack
product_meta.description: The most popular BAL unit is The Telescopic Stabilizing Jack. It is easy to install & requires no existing trailer-frame cross member. Will telescope to fit any under body frame. Will fit most trailers - front or rear. Limited lifetime warranty. Chrome speed wrench crank handle. 2,000 lbs. static load per jack. Made in U.S.A.
feature_bullets: Easy installation - can be bolted or welded to trailer frame

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars33 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
